docs.snippet: Ms. Pelosi, the House minority leader, argued to Mr. Ryan, the speaker, that “defending our democracy is more important than any advantage or disadvantage in this election.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Pelosi, the House minority leader, argued to Mr. Ryan, the speaker, that “defending our democracy is more important than any advantage or disadvantage in this election.”
docs.abstract: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi urges Speaker Paul D Ryan to bar Republicans from using documents hacked from Democratic National Committee by Russian intelligence agencies; Pelosi says Democrats and Republicans should stand united against Russian cyberattacks some see as possible attempt to manipulate presidential election.

headline.main: Nancy Pelosi Urges Paul Ryan to Ban Republicans From Using Hacked Documents
headline.print_headline: Pelosi Urges Ryan to Bar Republicans From Using Hacked Material

docs.snippet: Republican Donald Trump vowed Wednesday to boost defense spending and deploy more active troops, fighter planes, Navy ships and submarines as he works to convince skeptics in both parties that he's ready to lead the world's most powerful military....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Donald Trump vowed Wednesday to boost defense spending and deploy more active troops, fighter planes, Navy ships and submarines as he works to convince skeptics in both parties that he's ready to lead the world's most powerful military.

headline.main: Trump Promises Huge Boost in Military Spending
headline.print_headline: Trump Promises Huge Boost in Military Spending

docs.snippet: One of President Enrique Pena Nieto's closest advisers and confidants, Finance Secretary Luis Videgaray, resigned Wednesday in a move seen as linked to the unpopular decision to invite Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to visit Mexico...

headline.main: Mexico's Finance Secretary Resigns After Trump Visit

docs.snippet: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Wednesday  ended his ban on press credentials for some news outlets seeking to cover his campaign events, including The Washington Post and Buzzfeed, a policy that had drawn strong criticism f...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Wednesday  ended his ban on press credentials for some news outlets seeking to cover his campaign events, including The Washington Post and Buzzfeed, a policy that had drawn strong criticism from press freedom advocates.

headline.main: Trump Campaign Reverses Ban on Credentials for Some Media Outlets
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Reverses Ban on Credentials for Some Media Outlets

headline.main: U.S. Warns Russia Against Interfering With Western Politics
headline.print_headline: U.S. Warns Russia Against Interfering With Western Politics

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: Hundreds of billions of taxpayer dollars are spent each year on the country's public schools. The U.S. has record-high graduation rates, 82 percent, but also stubborn achievement gaps and dismally lagging math and reading scores compare...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: Hundreds of billions of taxpayer dollars are spent each year on the country's public schools. The U.S. has record-high graduation rates, 82 percent, but also stubborn achievement gaps and dismally lagging math and reading scores compared with other countries. And university degrees are leaving millions mired in debt. Few issues touch the lives of families like the state of education.

docs.snippet: Lawyers for the ousted Fox News chairman say he paid no money in a $20 million sexual harassment settlement with Gretchen Carlson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the ousted Fox News chairman say he paid no money in a $20 million sexual harassment settlement with Gretchen Carlson.
docs.abstract: Former Fox News chairman Roger Ailes, who left network in wake of sexual harassment lawsuit, remains defiant and denies all charges; Fox's parent firm 21st Century Fox gives $20 million to former host Gretchen Carlson to settle her accusations against Ailes; host Greta Van Susteren announces her immediate resignation from tension-filled network.

headline.main: Roger Ailes Stands Defiant as Fox Settles Lawsuits
headline.print_headline: Fallen Fox News Chairman Stands Defiant

docs.snippet: With Congress back at work, small business owners are hoping issues they care about like tax reform or health care will get some attention. They may be left waiting a while....
docs.lead_paragraph: With Congress back at work, small business owners are hoping issues they care about like tax reform or health care will get some attention. They may be left waiting a while.

headline.main: Small Businesses Look to Congress for Action, May Be Waiting
headline.print_headline: Small Businesses Look to Congress for Action, May Be Waiting

docs.snippet: The trip brought progress, but it was marred by a chaotic arrival ceremony in China and an ugly personal outburst from the Philippine president....
docs.lead_paragraph: The trip brought progress, but it was marred by a chaotic arrival ceremony in China and an ugly personal outburst from the Philippine president.
docs.abstract: Mishaps and insults have complicated Pres Obama's trip to Asia and overshadowed his intended purposes; mishandling of Obama's arrival at Group of 20 meeting in China and dispute with Philippines Pres Rodrigo Duterte highlight how poor planning and bad luck can undermine president's performance abroad and threaten American interests.

headline.main: Bad Luck and Worse Manners Tarnish Obama’s Asia Trip
headline.print_headline: Chaos, Insults and Bad Luck Tarnish Obama’s Visit to Asia
